text: Kwame Afriyie Adubofour Poku (born 11 August 2001) is an English professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Colchester United. ==Career== Born in Croydon, Poku joined Worthing from Cray Wanderers in February 2019. With Worthing, he made one senior appearance in the Kent Senior Cup and scored twice in twelve appearances in the 2018–19 Isthmian League. In May 2019, following a successful trial, he signed for Colchester United. On 3 September 2019, Poku made his professional debut for Colchester in a 3–2 EFL Trophy win against Gillingham. He scored his first professional goal on 21 September 2019 in Colchester's 2–1 victory against Leyton Orient. On 5 December 2019, Poku signed a new two-and-a-half year deal with Colchester to keep him with the Essex club until summer 2022. ==Personal life== Born in England, Poku is of Ghanaian descent. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=2|Colchester United |2019–20 |League Two |29||5||1||0||2||0||6||0||38||5 |- |2020–21 |League Two |6||0||0||0||1||0||1||0||8||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !35!!5!!1!!0!!3!!0!!7!!0!!46!!5 |} ==References== Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:Association football midfielders Category:English footballers Category:English people of Ghanaian descent Category:Cray Wanderers F.C. players Category:Worthing F.C. players Category:Colchester United F.C. players Category:Isthmian League players Category:English Football League players Category:Black English sportspeople Category:Footballers from Croydon
